intro: Teucrium laevigatum, commonly known as smooth germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. Teucrium laevigatum is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
